title: Fivestar4everMVP
author: Fivestar4everMVP
content: I personally think that the phrase "gambling for fun" is widely misunderstood by many gamblers.They think gambling for fun means gambling without any interest or hunger for profit, no body enjoys loosing money, and this in the other way simply means, loosing money is never fun, but how we choose to react is what makes the difference... I wil tell you all what gambling for fun means to me personally.. Here Is What Gambling For Fun Mean To MeTo me, gambling for fun simply means - gambling, with hopes of making profit, but with the consciousness that if the profit does not come, I choose not to react negatively to the loss, or allow the loss way me down or make me feel bad, I just focus/put/fix my mind on the fun I had playing the game rather than focus or fix my mind on the money I lost.If gambling for fun means gambling without any need or hope of making profit, why throw away or waste my money then? I would just put the game in a demo mood and play - I believe a lot of casinos have this feature.But like I explained above, gambling for fun for me is not gambling with no interest in making profit, in gambling for fun, I hope to make profit, but I just consciously don't make the profit a priority, this means that if at the end of the game, I make a profit, i am happy, because I hoped for it, but if I don't make profit, I am not sad, I am not unhappy, because it wasn't a priority, and for me not to feel sad, I get my mind off the money lost and focus on the fun I had playing the game - Being happy is a choice, I hope we all know this.So over to you now, what does gambling for fun mean to you as a gambler,? As I know that this phrase might mean different things for different people, would like to know what your understanding is on this.

comments.author: lionheart78
comments.body: I share the same thought.  For me, gambling for fun means raking in winnings, rewards, and bonuses.  I also agree that it is not fun to see our bankroll depleted during our session.  I also don't believe that people are trully gambling for entertainment's sake (without the thought of profit).  After all, what is our reason why we are betting and wagering amoutns if we don't hope in winnings?  So yeah gambling for fun to me is gambling to win.  But of course, I always gamble on what I can afford to lose.

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on December 30, 2022, 05:34:25 PMSo over to you now, what does gambling for fun mean to you as a gambler, As I know that this phrase might mean different things for different people, would like to know what your understanding is on this. When someone says they had fun while engaging in an activity, it means the activity was enjoyable to them. Many people do not enjoy the process and thrill of gambling but are simply only focused on making profit, that is not gambling for fun. If you gamble for fun, every process, from analyzing games to coming to a conclusion an outcome, to placing your bet will all be exciting an enjoyable to you, even the suspense of waiting for the outcome you predicted to either be correct or not will be thrilling and an exciting process. This is when gambles for fun. Gambling for fun also means, it is not a source of income for you, and you don't depend on it for money but just doing it because of the pleasure you get while engaging in the activity.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Gambling for fun is simply just betting on something you like doing or watching. But whether you gamble for fun or not, it's only ourselves who knows it. It only feels like you are fooling yourself by betting on sports you don't like but cheering for the team you put your money on. Its probably a gambler's idea of fun but for some people, the idea of fun is just partying and drinking and catching up with friends.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: I gamble for fun, and believe it or not even after I make a profit on my account, I will just leave it there in the casino and use it for next week once I play again. People like us exist, and every time Saturday comes, I already look forward to losing $20 in the casino because I know I won't win anything. It's not like I hate winning or that I don't care about winning, it's just that I already accepted the fact that the small wins here and there will never be a permanent streak, and that's what I'm chasing - the small wins.But of course if I win big on the casino, I'd probably think twice in leaving that amount or cashing it out. The most I've won with dice is $100+, and I still leave it there and thought that it will be 5 weeks worth of gambling budget for me. I enjoy playing dice, especially if I see my balance slowly going up after a series of bad beats. Then again, I'm just after the thrill, the excitement - basically the emotions that one can get when playing with something that involves luck and chance in the same sentence.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on December 30, 2022, 05:34:25 PMSo over to you now, what does gambling for fun mean to you as a gambler,? As I know that this phrase might mean different things for different people, would like to know what your understanding is on this. Most of the time I gamble for fun, and when I say for fun it speaks for a lot of things like enjoying the game, enjoying all my bets and of course enjoying making money out of my small capital, this is also my way of releasing my stress so probably its more about fun. Many might misunderstood your reason about gambling as your way of fun but that's ok as long as you still have self-discipline and know when to stop, you are still good to go and free to gamble anytime.

comments.author: Vaculin
comments.body: Quote from: lionheart78 on December 30, 2022, 05:45:04 PMI share the same thought.  For me, gambling for fun means raking in winnings, rewards, and bonuses.  I also agree that it is not fun to see our bankroll depleted during our session.  I also don't believe that people are trully gambling for entertainment's sake (without the thought of profit).  After all, what is our reason why we are betting and wagering amoutns if we don't hope in winnings?  So yeah gambling for fun to me is gambling to win.  But of course, I always gamble on what I can afford to lose. Same here. No one would want to gamble in the first place without wanting profits, because for me that’s the initial motivation of a gambler, to play and win. But of course, since gambling is mostly a game of chance, you cannot guarantee profits all the time. That’s when we have to be open both losing and profiting. So yes, I also share the same thought, when I won, I became happy, but when I lose, that doesn’t mean I need to be mad. As long as I still play with satisfaction, that reason alone is profitable already.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: To gamble for fun for me is simple. Gambling without expecting any form of win or whatsoever. I gamble knowing I'll lose all the money I have dedicated for gambling for that day, and thus far it has given me outdtandingvresults in my mental health and handling my emotions. When you don't expect anything, the simplest things will make you happy. And that's just what I did. I never expect to win any games because I know for a fact if let that mindset get to me, I'm gonna spiral into madness and will ultimately find myself addicted to gambling. So gamble with less expectations except to have fun and enjoy your time inside the casino, savor every win and shrug off every loss whilst maintaining a clear mind on what your spending limits are, and you'll find yourself gambling for fun.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Quote from: goaldigger on December 30, 2022, 06:31:48 PMQuote from: Fivestar4everMVP on December 30, 2022, 05:34:25 PMSo over to you now, what does gambling for fun mean to you as a gambler,? Most of the time I gamble for fun, and when I say for fun it speaks for a lot of things like enjoying the game, enjoying all my bets and of course enjoying making money out of my small capital, this is also my way of releasing my stress so probably its more about fun. Many might misunderstood your reason about gambling as your way of fun but that's ok as long as you still have self-discipline and know when to stop, you are still good to go and free to gamble anytime.  I guess no matter how we say it, gambling for fun is not just enjoying the game alone, but also enjoying the profits that we have luckily made. Since we don’t also want to gamble losing all the time, of course that would be a waste of time and money if that’s the case. Personally, I have to say that I can only enjoy gambling when the game is of my high interest, and it’s always challenging me. And it would be more fun if course if I’m also making profits from it. But if it’s not, that would be fine as long as you are only gambling your extra money.

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: Even if deny it, we are more happy if we make money in gambling so technically, gambling with profit are more fun and many uses this as their excuse but deep inside, they are really aiming to get some profit. I do gamble for fun while targeting to make some profit, there’s nothing wrong with this. All you have to do is to be more responsible, don’t let your emotion to control you because too much gambling is not safe, it can result into addiction.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Having fun is a subjective feeling to any gambler. There are gamblers that have think that they're having fun and converted their losses into it so, they won't blame themselves for having that because they've already believed that they're just there for fun and losing isn't a big matter anymore.But we all know what we want.We want to win and we want to make profit but I think, this reasoning is a good mechanism for someone who's hardly accepting losses.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on December 30, 2022, 05:34:25 PMHere Is What Gambling For Fun Mean To MeTo me, gambling for fun simply means - gambling, with hopes of making profit, but with the consciousness that if the profit does not come, I choose not to react negatively to the loss, or allow the loss way me down or make me feel bad, I just focus/put/fix my mind on the fun I had playing the game rather than focus or fix my mind on the money I lost.You deposit $100. Place a bet of $20 then lose, you are down $20.You place a two fold of $10, lose it, you are down to $30You place a bet of $20, win it. You make $20. You have now $90You place a bet of $10 and win it. You make more $20 this time because the odd was good. You have now $110.You place a bet of $10 again. Lose it. You are now at where you started, $100.In between, your whole evening is wasted. You go to sleep and plan for tomorrow.You place a bet of $10 to test and lose it, you are down o $90You lose patience and bet $50 this time with and odd of 1/2. You win it. You have now $115. You are excited.You try with $15 to make more $15. But unfortunately lose again. $100 now you have.You are feeling lucky this time and again place a bet of $50 with an odd of 1.80. This time you lose it. You are down to $50.Upset and try with $20 again. Lose it and you are down to $30.In the mean time it's bed time. You feel you have nothing left so you put $30 in a random match. The balance is zero now.Wake up in the morning you wait for the match to start. Match starts and you win. You balance become $50 again.This way your entire weekend is wasted and you are down to $50 from $100 initially deposited.You wait for the next week.This is gambling for me. Well it used to be. Gambling means, taking stress while you are having fun. But the worse thing happen with you is that you lose your time which you could use into something productive for your life and the people connected with you.

comments.body: From my own point of perspective gambling for fun mean gambling and betting in my own area of specialization example soccer bettin,  I play bet based on my vast knowledge and exposure on the game being a former soccer player, I pick some fixtures in major leagues make analysis on each of my pick for fun and place my bet accordingly, though the ultimate aim is to earn profit thus serve as another source of income, there is nothing like fun here because gambling involves money and I can't afford to throw away my hard earned money for the sake of any fun rather it's a pure craft, however I always gamble with fund I can afford to lose.

I can understand it, because casino games prioritize luck. know that in fact, we are staking the same fate as other gamblers. So, I never expected more to get big rewards. especially with limited capital, I play loose without caring about winning or losing. Don't say that I don't like luck, of course I do too.it's just that, because my priority is to bet on a sportsbook, namely football betting. of course, I have to involve a lot of knowledge, information, new news sources and all kinds in order to minimize the chances of defeat. and sportsbook gambling is different from casino gambling. because in sports, we can have a greater chance of winning because it involves skills and knowledge. however, I will also say that it is also a fun bet because I love soccer.The point is, I don't expect to always win bets, let alone casino gambling. but in football, we can choose according to what we know. if I lose today, I will end the bet as well as when I lose the casino game. if I'm lucky, I will still end the betting session because there is still tomorrow that I can continue, to get back to having fun.

comments.author: Kasabus
comments.body: Quote from: bittraffic on December 30, 2022, 06:09:11 PMGambling for fun is simply just betting on something you like doing or watching. But whether you gamble for fun or not, it's only ourselves who knows it. It only feels like you are fooling yourself by betting on sports you don't like but cheering for the team you put your money on. Its probably a gambler's idea of fun but for some people, the idea of fun is just partying and drinking and catching up with friends.  Gambling alone is fun if you do it more for entertainment, and not just for the profits you can gain from it. But it would be more fun and satisfying too if you gamble and then you won eventually. But I believe if you see gambling as another way of making money, that won’t be fun anymore if you gamble and then you keep losing your funds. My idea of gambling for fun, is that you do it naturally with your good friends, without being pressured that you also need to make profits as well.

It is easy to say it like that, but a lot of people can definitely win or lose to be emotionless; in actual terms, it’s going to be hard to practice

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on December 30, 2022, 05:34:25 PMHere Is What Gambling For Fun Mean To MeTo me, gambling for fun simply means - gambling, with hopes of making profit, but with the consciousness that if the profit does not come, I choose not to react negatively to the loss, or allow the loss way me down or make me feel bad, I just focus/put/fix my mind on the fun I had playing the game rather than focus or fix my mind on the money I lost.I think you nailed it here, some people do think they just to past the time but honestly there's that unconscious mind that always tells us that "if I win it's even more fun". I think when we gamble when we were kids that's where the real kind of fun in gambling, it's not necessarily about money you're gambling with (especially if you're into a neighborhood that doesn't mind child gambling) but something you win on things plus the time well spent to play with other child, that's where the fun comes.
